basics.name: Thomas J. Maierhofer
basics.label: Lecturer, UCLA Department of Statistics & Data Science

work.name: Department of Statistics & Data Science
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

courses: MSc Thesis: Classification of Functional Data

_awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
_awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
